@TooSmart15 no, but the 'creation' of bitcoin didn't create the coins, it created the ability to create the coins. Satoshi had to mine it too

@TheJackForge I think I agree about Bitcoin though. I want a decentralized currency so bad, but I think it's gone in a different direction than Satoshi's whitepaper. I also don't believe inflation is always a bad thing (if controlled) so maybe a capped coin isn't a good idea for a currency

@TheJackForge I also think if the only crypto that is currency is a stablecoin it defeats two of the entire purposes of crypto - inflation avoidance and decentralization. Fiat backed coins are centralized, and they just follow the inflation of whatever it's pegged to

@TheJackForge I mean, sure, but the only reason altcoins are going to make any money through yield farming is if someone else views it as a utility, and most of those utilities fit into either a currency or store of value

@javalist An ‚Äòasset‚Äô can mean anything. Cars are depreciating assets, houses are appreciating assets, gold is a store of value asset. I also think that ofc it‚Äôs both, but generally currencies aren‚Äôt advised to be used as a store of value, so btc will most likely fall into one main category

I don't understand why people keep talking about the metaverse and web3 as if they're the same thing

Developing a 'metaverse' (the usual definition) is incredibly costly and requires big teams, most likely centralized

It just isn't web3 to me (without NFTs etc) I don't get it
